Title: Ready or not
Cast: Samara Weaving, Adam Brody, Mark O'Brien, Henry Czerny
Awards: Saturn Award nomination for Best Horror Film
Themes/Tags: Dark comedy, survival horror, class warfare, family secrets
Synopsis: A young bride joins her new husband's rich family in a time-honored tradition that turns into a lethal game with everyone fighting for survival
Interesting facts: The mansion used was a real historic estate in Toronto; Samara Weaving did many of her own stunts

Title: 12 hommes en colère
Cast: Henry Fonda, Lee J. Cobb, Ed Begley, E.G. Marshall
Themes/Tags: Justice, prejudice, moral responsibility, group dynamics
Synopsis: A dissenting juror in a murder trial slowly manages to convince the others that the case is not as obviously clear as it seemed in court
Interesting facts: Almost entirely filmed in one room; Henry Fonda produced and took a pay cut to make it happen

Title: Usual Suspect
Cast: Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne, Benicio del Toro, Kevin Spacey
Filming Locations: Los Angeles, New York City, San Pedro
Themes/Tags: Unreliable narrator, crime syndicate, mystery, plot twist
Synopsis: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat
Interesting facts: The famous lineup scene was improvised - actors kept breaking character and laughing

Title: Apocalypto
Cast: Rudy Youngblood, Dalia Hernández, Jonathan Brewer
Themes/Tags: Pre-Columbian civilization, survival, prophecy, Mayan culture
Synopsis: A young man is taken on a perilous journey to a world ruled by fear and oppression as the Mayan kingdom faces decline
Interesting facts: Entirely spoken in Yucatec Maya; used mainly indigenous and mixed-race Mexican actors

Title: La passion du Christ
Cast: Jim Caviezel, Maia Morgenstern, Monica Bellucci
Themes/Tags: Religious drama, sacrifice, faith, biblical narrative
Synopsis: Depicts the final twelve hours in the life of Jesus of Nazareth on the day of his crucifixion
Interesting facts: Jim Caviezel was struck by lightning during filming; one of highest-grossing R-rated films ever

Title: Us
Cast: Lupita Nyong'o, Winston Duke, Elisabeth Moss, Tim Heidecker
Awards: NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Motion Picture
Themes/Tags: Doppelgangers, class inequality, identity, psychological horror
Synopsis: A family's serene beach vacation turns to chaos when their doppelgängers appear and begin to terrorize them
Interesting facts: Jordan Peele's follow-up to Get Out; extensive use of scissors as weapon symbolism

Title: Requiem pour un massacre
Cast: Aleksei Kravchenko, Olga Mironova, Liubomiras Laucevicius
Themes/Tags: War trauma, loss of innocence, Nazi occupation, survival
Synopsis: A teenage boy joins Soviet partisans during WWII and experiences the horrors of war firsthand
Interesting facts: Considered one of the greatest war films ever made; took 8 years to get permission to film

Title: Cliffhanger
Cast: Sylvester Stallone, John Lithgow, Michael Rooker, Janine Turner
Awards: MTV Movie Award for Best Action Sequence
Themes/Tags: Mountain climbing, heist, survival, redemption
Synopsis: A mountain climber becomes embroiled in the failed heist of a U.S. Treasury plane flying through the Rocky Mountains
Interesting facts: Many stunts performed without safety equipment; one of the most expensive films of 1993

Title: Le trou
Cast: Michel Constantin, Jean Keraudy, Philippe Leroy, Raymond Meunier
Themes/Tags: Prison escape, camaraderie, betrayal, suspense
Synopsis: Four cellmates plan an elaborate escape from prison but their plans are jeopardized by a new inmate
Interesting facts: Based on a true story; actual former prisoner José Giovanni co-wrote the screenplay

Title: Dallas Buyers Club
Cast: Matthew McConaughey, Jared Leto, Jennifer Garner
Themes/Tags: AIDS crisis, pharmaceutical industry, determination, discrimination
Synopsis: An AIDS patient fights the system to help others get access to experimental drugs
Interesting facts: Matthew McConaughey lost 47 pounds for the role; based on true story of Ron Woodroof

Title: Le garçon qui domptât le vent
Cast: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Maxwell Simba, Aïssa Maïga
Themes/Tags: Education, determination, renewable energy, family
Synopsis: A 13-year-old boy in Malawi builds a wind turbine to save his village from famine
Interesting facts: Based on true story; Chiwetel Ejiofor's directorial debut; real William Kamkwamba appears in film

Title: Le vieux fusils
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Romy Schneider, Jean Bouise
Awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
Themes/Tags: WWII, revenge, family tragedy, resistance
Synopsis: A French surgeon seeks revenge after his family is killed by German soldiers during WWII
Interesting facts: Won Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film; Romy Schneider's powerful performance

Title: Vice
Cast: Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Steve Carell, Sam Rockwell
Themes/Tags: Political satire, power corruption, American politics
Synopsis: The story of Dick Cheney's rise to power as Vice President under George W. Bush
Interesting facts: Christian Bale gained 40 pounds and learned to speak like Cheney; highly stylized biographical approach

Title: La vie aquatique
Cast: Bill Murray, Owen Wilson, Cate Blanchett, Anjelica Huston
Themes/Tags: Midlife crisis, adventure, family dynamics, whimsical storytelling
Synopsis: An aging oceanographer seeks revenge on the mythical shark that killed his partner
Interesting facts: Features elaborate handmade sea creatures; signature Wes Anderson visual style and symmetry

Title: Nord by Northwest
Cast: Cary Grant, Eva Marie Saint, James Mason, Martin Landau
Themes/Tags: Mistaken identity, espionage, chase thriller, Cold War
Synopsis: An advertising executive is mistaken for a spy and pursued across the country by enemy agents
Interesting facts: Famous Mount Rushmore chase scene; one of Hitchcock's most entertaining thrillers

Title: Man of the U.N.C.L.E.
Cast: Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander, Elizabeth Debicki
Themes/Tags: Cold War, espionage, stylish action, 1960s setting
Synopsis: CIA and KGB agents team up during the Cold War to stop a criminal organization from using nuclear weapons
Interesting facts: Based on 1960s TV series; stylish period piece with retro aesthetic

Title: La vie des autres
Cast: Ulrich Mühe, Martina Gedeck, Sebastian Koch
Awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
Themes/Tags: East Germany, surveillance, moral awakening, Stasi
Synopsis: A Stasi agent becomes increasingly absorbed by the lives of the couple he is spying on
Interesting facts: Director's debut film; won Oscar; Ulrich Mühe's final major role before his death

Title: L'Arrivée d'un train en gare de La Ciotat
Cast: None
Themes/Tags: Cinema history, documentary, early filmmaking
Synopsis: One of the first films ever made showing a train arriving at a station
Interesting facts: Legendary audience reaction: people allegedly jumped back thinking train would hit them

Title: Citizen Kane
Cast: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Dorothy Comingore, Agnes Moorehead
Awards: Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay
Themes/Tags: Media mogul, power corruption, American Dream, character study
Synopsis: A group of reporters investigates the dying words of a newspaper tycoon
Interesting facts: Often cited as greatest film ever made; revolutionary cinematography and narrative structure

Title: A Nous Quatre
Cast: Bulle Ogier, Juliet Berto, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Jade
Themes/Tags: Female friendship, mystery, conspiracy, feminism
Synopsis: Two women investigate a mysterious plot involving their friends in 1970s Paris
Interesting facts: Part of Rivette's experimental period; long runtime and complex narrative structure

Title: Psychose
Cast: Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, John Gavin
Themes/Tags: Psychological horror, split personality, murder, suspense
Synopsis: A young woman steals money and encounters a disturbed motel owner with a troubled relationship with his mother
Interesting facts: Revolutionary horror film; famous shower scene; Anthony Perkins' iconic performance

Title: Sausage Party
Cast: Seth Rogen, Kristen Wiig, Jonah Hill, Bill Hader
Themes/Tags: Adult animation, food comedy, existentialism, parody
Synopsis: Food items in a supermarket discover the truth about what happens when customers take them home
Interesting facts: First R-rated computer-animated film; controversial for adult themes in animated format

Title: Walkyrie
Cast: Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson
Themes/Tags: WWII, assassination plot, resistance, conspiracy
Synopsis: A dramatization of the July 20 1944 assassination plot by German army officers to kill Hitler
Interesting facts: Based on true events; Tom Cruise controversially cast as German officer

Title: La Chute
Cast: Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Corinna Harfouch
Awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Foreign Language Film
Themes/Tags: Hitler's final days, WWII, bunker drama, historical
Synopsis: The final days of Adolf Hitler and his inner circle in the Führerbunker during the Battle of Berlin
Interesting facts: Bruno Ganz's powerful portrayal of Hitler; based on memoirs of Hitler's secretary

Title: Last House on the Left
Cast: Tony Goldwyn, Monica Potter, Garret Dillahunt
Themes/Tags: Revenge, survival horror, family protection, violence
Synopsis: Parents seek revenge after their daughter is brutally attacked by escaped convicts
Interesting facts: Remake of Wes Craven's 1972 film; controversial for graphic violence

Title: Once upon a time in America P1
Cast: Robert De Niro, James Woods, Elizabeth McGovern, Joe Pesci
Themes/Tags: Friendship, crime saga, memory, Jewish-American experience
Synopsis: Epic tale of a group of Jewish-American gangsters from childhood through their final years
Interesting facts: Leone's final film; originally 6 hours, cut to 4 for release; complex non-linear narrative

Title: Once upon a time in America P2
Cast: Robert De Niro, James Woods, Elizabeth McGovern, Joe Pesci
Themes/Tags: Friendship, crime saga, memory, Jewish-American experience
Synopsis: Continuation of epic tale spanning decades of Jewish-American gangster life
Interesting facts: Second part of extended viewing; explores themes of betrayal and the cost of violence

Title: The Father
Cast: Anthony Hopkins, Olivia Colman, Mark Gatiss, Imogen Poots
Themes/Tags: Dementia, family relationships, aging, memory loss
Synopsis: An aging man refuses assistance from his daughter as he struggles with dementia
Interesting facts: Anthony Hopkins won Oscar at age 83; innovative portrayal of dementia from patient's perspective

Title: Le voyage de Chiro
Cast: Daveigh Chase, Suzanne Pleshette, Jason Marsden (English dub)
Awards: Academy Award for Best Animated Feature
Themes/Tags: Coming of age, Japanese folklore, environmentalism, family
Synopsis: A young girl enters a world ruled by gods and witches where she must save her parents
Interesting facts: Highest-grossing film in Japanese history; Miyazaki's masterpiece; rich cultural symbolism

Title: The Brocken cercle breakdown
Cast: Nicholas Cage, Joaquin Phoenix, James Gandolfini, Peter Stormare
Themes/Tags: Surveillance, paranoia, crime investigation, technology
Synopsis: A surveillance expert becomes the target of a deadly conspiracy
Interesting facts: Pre-digital age paranoia thriller; strong ensemble cast performance

Title: Good bye Lénine
Cast: Daniel Brühl, Katrin Sass, Chulpan Khamatova
Awards: European Film Award for Best Film
Themes/Tags: German reunification, family, political change, nostalgia
Synopsis: A young man protects his mother from the shock of German reunification by recreating East Germany in their apartment
Interesting facts: Touching portrayal of German reunification; Daniel Brühl's breakout performance

Title: La grande Bellezza
Cast: Toni Servillo, Carlo Verdone, Sabrina Ferilli
Awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film
Themes/Tags: Decadent Rome, aging, beauty, existentialism
Synopsis: An aging writer reflects on his life and the eternal city of Rome
Interesting facts: Visually stunning portrayal of contemporary Rome; Oscar winner for Best Foreign Language Film

Title: Old Boy
Cast: Choi Min-sik, Yoo Ji-tae, Kang Hye-jung
Themes/Tags: Revenge, imprisonment, mystery, psychological thriller
Synopsis: A man seeks vengeance after being imprisoned for 15 years without knowing why
Interesting facts: Part of Park's Vengeance Trilogy; famous hallway fight scene; controversial ending

Title: Tueurs
Cast: Ashton Kutcher, Katherine Heigl, Tom Selleck, Catherine O'Hara
Themes/Tags: Assassin comedy, marriage, suburban life, action comedy
Synopsis: A vacationing woman falls for a hitman who wants to leave his dangerous life behind
Interesting facts: Generic action-comedy; criticized for formulaic plot and chemistry between leads

Title: The Thing

Awards: Saturn Award for Best Horror Film
Themes/Tags: Isolation, paranoia, alien horror, survival
Synopsis: A research team in Antarctica discovers an alien being that can perfectly imitate other organisms
Interesting facts: Carpenter's masterpiece; revolutionary practical effects; initial box office failure became cult classic

Title: Vertigo
Cast: James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes
Themes/Tags: Obsession, identity, psychological manipulation, voyeurism
Synopsis: A former detective with acrophobia investigates a friend's wife but becomes obsessed with her

Title: A bout de souffle

Title: Casablanca

Themes/Tags: WWII, romance, sacrifice, resistance
Synopsis: An American expatriate must choose between his love for a woman and helping her escape Casablanca
Interesting facts: Classic Hollywood romance; iconic dialogue and performances; enduring cultural impact

Title: Le labyrinthe de Pan

Title: The Last duel

Themes/Tags: Medieval justice, perspectives, honor, sexual assault

Title: Don't look up

Themes/Tags: Climate change allegory, media satire, political commentary
Synopsis: Two scientists try to warn humanity about an approaching comet that will destroy Earth

Title: The Skin I Leave

Themes/Tags: Identity, transformation, revenge, gender
Synopsis: A plastic surgeon seeks revenge on the men who raped his daughter
Interesting facts: Almodóvar's return to thriller genre; complex narrative about identity and transformation

Title: The Host

Synopsis: A monster emerges from Seoul's Han River and terrorizes the city while a family searches for their daughter

Title: Drive

Synopsis: A mysterious stuntman moonlighting as a getaway driver becomes involved in a heist gone wrong
Interesting facts: Stylized neo-noir; electronic soundtrack; Ryan Gosling's iconic performance; art-house action

Title: Isle of Dogs

Synopsis: In a dystopian Japan dogs are exiled to a trash island where a boy searches for his pet

Title: Match Point

Awards: Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay
Themes/Tags: Class, adultery, luck, moral ambiguity

Interesting facts: Allen's successful move to London; exploration of luck versus morality in life

Title: 36 quaid des orfèvres

Title: Amistad

Themes/Tags: Slavery, legal drama, human rights, historical

Title: Le bon la brute et le truand

Interesting facts: Gunn's reboot/sequel; R-rated DC film; blend of humor and violence; ensemble cast

Title: Misery

Title: HEAT

Title: La vie d'une courgette

Title: Blade runner 2049

Title: Hidden Figures

Title: Lost in Translation

Title: Apocalypse Now

Title: Top Gun

Title: 2001: l'odyssée de l'espace

Title: Le silence des agneaux

Title: The Hunt

Title: Everything Everywhere All at Once

Title: Nuovo cinema Paradiso

Title: Le dictateur

Title: Midsommar

Title: J'accuse

Title: True Romance

Title: Incroyable mais vrai

Title: Le salaire de la peur

Title: Les évadés

Title: The Guilty

Title: Fargo

Title: True Grif
